Body: Description: Looking for help to recreate a report without few details automatically and mail to a specific DL on a weekly basis.

What We've Learned Updated: +++++
CIFS Open Access Report
+++++
Data gathering is to depth of Level 5
They want a report to depth of Level 0.

1) Global Settings > Notifications to set up email.

2) "FileSystem" > 1-FSAA System Scans  > Query Properties > Default Scoping is set with "Limit sub-folder scan depth to 5 levels"

3) BUT they only want the report to display Scan Depth = 0 and only one host name (it currently has his 2 hostnames).

4) I think it is about building another table and filtering the data that goes into the second table.

What We've Learned Updated: +++++
CIFS Open Access Report
+++++
a) Current data gathering is to depth of Level 5
b) Customer wants to email a report with a depth of Level 0 only and for only one (1) of their 2 hostnames.
c) Customer wants to maintain the original report with the 2 hostnames and to a depth of Level 5.

#####
1) Global Settings > Notifications to set up email.

2) "FileSystem" > 1-FSAA System Scans  > Query Properties > Default Scoping is set with "Limit sub-folder scan depth to 5 levels"

3) But they only want the report to display records with a Scan Depth = 0 and only one host name (the current report has their 2 hostnames and recoreds with a scan depth of up to 5).

4) I think the task is to build another table and filter the data that goes into the second table. 
#####

+++++

a) Current data gathering is to depth of Level 5

b) Customer wants to email a report with a depth of Level 0 only and for only one (1) of their 2 hostnames.

c) Customer wants to maintain the original report with the 2 hostnames and to a depth of Level 5.

 

#####

1) Global Settings > Notifications to set up email.

 

2) "FileSystem" > 1-FSAA System Scans > Query Properties > Default Scoping is set with "Limit sub-folder scan depth to 5 levels"

 

3) But they only want the report to display records with a Scan Depth = 0 and only one host name (the current report has their 2 hostnames and recoreds with a scan depth of up to 5).

 

4) I think the task is to build another table and filter the data that goes into the second table.

#####
Next Steps Updated: Build an example of the report in my lab possibly.

What We've Learned Updated: +++++
CIFS Open Access Report
+++++
a) Current data gathering is to depth of Level 5
b) Customer wants to email a report with a depth of Level 0 only and for only one (1) of their 2 hostnames.
c) Customer wants to maintain the original report with the 2 hostnames and to a depth of Level 5.

#####
1) Global Settings > Notifications to set up email.

2) "FileSystem" > "0.Collection" > "1-FSAA System Scans"  "Configure" > "Queries" > Query Properties > Default Scoping is set with "Limit sub-folder scan depth to 5 levels"

3) But they only want the report to display records with a Scan Depth = 0 and only one host name (the current report has their 2 hostnames and recoreds with a scan depth of up to 5).

4) I think the task is to build another table and filter the data that goes into the second table.

b) Customer wants to email a report with a depth of Level 0 only and for only one (1) of their 2 hostnames.

1) Global Settings > Notifications to set up email.

2) "FileSystem" > "0.Collection" > "1-FSAA System Scans" > "Configure" > "Queries" > Query Properties > Default Scoping is set with "Limit sub-folder scan depth to 5 levels"

3) But they only want the report to display records with a Scan Depth = 0 and only one host name (the current report has their 2 hostnames and recoreds with a scan depth of up to 5).

What We've Learned Updated: +++++
CIFS Open Access Report
+++++
a) Current data gathering is to depth of Level 5
b) Customer wants to email a report with a depth of Level 0 only and for only one (1) of their 2 hostnames.
c) Customer wants to maintain the original report with the 2 hostnames and to a depth of Level 5.

#####
1) Global Settings > Notifications to set up email.

2) In NEA navigate to: Jobs > "FileSystem" > "0.Collection" > "1-FSAA System Scans" > "Configure" > "Queries" > "Query Properties" > Configure button > "Default Scoping" is set with "Limit sub-folder scan depth to 5 levels"

3) But they only want the report to display records with a Scan Depth = 0 and only one host name (the current report has their 2 hostnames and records with a scan depth of up to 5).

4) I think the task is to build another table and filter the data that goes into the second table. 
#####
